events.message: Customer reported a two-car collision that occurred on Main Street causing significant damage to the front bumper and windshield.
The claim was categorized under 'Auto Accident' after verifying keywords related to vehicle collision and damage.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident case and will be the primary point of contact.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the accident claim and assured the customer of prompt assistance.
Requested police report, photos of the damage, and a repair estimate to proceed with the claim investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and multiple photographs showing vehicle damages.
The insurer's investigator began examining submitted evidence and contacting witnesses to validate claim.
Investigation concluded confirming fault was determined, and the extent of vehicle damage was fully assessed.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover repairs and related costs based on the damage appraisal.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the clear communication throughout the process.
The claim was officially approved after the customer accepted the settlement offer without hesitation.
Payment was issued to the customer to cover the repair costs for the damaged vehicle from the accident.
The claim file was closed following full resolution and payment, marking completion of all necessary steps.
All documentation and records related to the auto accident claim were securely archived for future reference.
